section.description: The Web Browser window allows you to view and interact with an HTML page, but does not include full browser controls. The use of the shell.explorer ActiveX control allows you to select pages to view. Refer to {ACTIVEX} and Display an Xdialog Box for more information. This approach to displaying HTML is similar to the HTML Text Window.
section.example: dim edit as P dim edit.object as P dim edit.class as C dim edit.events as C dim shared varC_result as C dim edit_url as C edit.class = "shell.explorer" edit.events = <<%code% ... %code% edit_url = "" ok_button_label = "&OK" cancel_button_label = "&Cancel" varC_result = ui_dlg_box("Browser Window",<<%dlg% {startup=init} {region} URL: | [.50edit_url] <&GO!edit_go>; | {activex=100,25edit?.f.}; {endregion}; {line=1,0}; {region} <*15=ok_button_label!OK> <15=cancel_button_label!CANCEL> {endregion}; %dlg%,<<%code% if a_dlg_button = "init" then a_dlg_button = "" hourglass_cursor(.t.) if edit_url <> "" then on error goto edit_error edit.object.navigate(edit_url) on error goto 0 end if hourglass_cursor(.f.) end if if a_dlg_button = "edit_go" then a_dlg_button = "" hourglass_cursor(.t.) if edit_url <> "" then on error goto edit_error edit.object.navigate(edit_url) on error goto 0 end if hourglass_cursor(.f.) end if end edit_error: ui_msg_box("Error","Invalid URL.",UI_STOP_SYMBOL) end %code%)
